name: Endrowednes Kuantama
content: Endrowednes Kuantama - Macquarie University View Scopus Profile Endrowednes Kuantama Dr Lecturer in IoT/Networking, School of ComputingAdvanced Drone Systems Research Centre https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1615-7243 Phone+61 2 9850 4140Emailendrowednes.kuantamamq.eduau h-index 409 Citations 11 h-index Calculated based on number of publications stored in Pure and citations from Scopus 20082025 Research activity per year Personal profile BiographyDr. Endrowednes Kuantama undertook the role of Lecturer in IoT and Networking at Macquarie University's School of Computing in 2023. A distinguished ERASMUS MUNDUS scholar, he successfully completed his doctoral studies at Oradea University, Romania. Before joining Macquarie, Dr. Kuantama served as an Assistant Professor in the Engineering Department at Kyungsung University, South Korea, followed by a position as a Postdoctoral Research Fellow at Macquarie University's School of Computing. Dr. Kuantama is actively involved in pioneering research within the Drone Lab, focusing on cutting-edge areas such as aerial manipulation, the Internet of Drones, control systems, and advanced sensor fusion techniques. His significant contribution to academia is reflected in a robust publication record, with 27 authored works featured in reputable books, conferences, and journals. Beyond his research pursuits, Dr. Kuantama plays a vital role in the academic community. He serves as a dedicated reviewer for the Drone and Aerospace Journal and holds an esteemed editorial board position for the International Journal for Smart Sensing and Intelligent Systems.Research interestsInternet of DronesDesign and implementation of Unmanned Aerial Vehicles for aerial manipulationSensing, recognition, and path planning for autonomous droneMachine learning and data analyticsSLAM algorithms and robotics control system Fingerprint Dive into the research topics where Endrowednes Kuantama is active.
